text: it did

elements.text: it did

text: right before this there was an issue with denex they upload the 0.2.2 version to onboarding page and the installation failed

elements.text: right before this there was an issue with denex they upload the 0.2.2 version to onboarding page and the installation failed

text: later on, they told me to use 0.2.3-dev and reupload the new dar file to their onboarding portal.

elements.text: later on, they told me to use 0.2.3-dev and reupload the new dar file to their onboarding portal.

text: but in the interim i also upgrade this node...maybe a bad idea.

elements.text: but in the interim i also upgrade this node...maybe a bad idea.

text: is there a way to uninstall it  from the console ?

elements.text: is there a way to uninstall it  from the console ?

text: How to determine whether the node is deployed successfully?

elements.text: How to determine whether the node is deployed successfully?

text: it works today for me as well :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: it works today for me as well

text: My understanding is that these two values ​​can be set at will. But I don't know where these two values ​​are used.

elements.text: My understanding is that these two values ​​can be set at will. But I don't know where these two values ​​are used.

text: I mean how to check if my node has joined the network

elements.text: I mean how to check if my node has joined the network

text: These values are used in OAuth2 access tokens and they are verified on backend apps. If a value configured on a backend doesn't match the one in a token of an HTTP request then the backend will reject the request.

elements.text: These values are used in OAuth2 access tokens and they are verified on backend apps. If a value configured on a backend doesn't match the one in a token of an HTTP request then the backend will reject the request.

text: The first one is for participant, the second one is for validator.

elements.text: The first one is for participant, the second one is for validator.

Hi

,

I had update the log from above of particpant. It's just contains enough info.
The cause is below but message isn't that useful. that's the only relevant log that has useful information.

DAR_NOT_VALID_UPGRADE(8,6c3ab253): The uploaded DAR contains a package e48ea337ee3335c8bb3206a2501ce947ac1a7bdb1825cee8f28bad64f5a7bc4b (splice-wallet-payments v0.1.8), but upgrade checks indicate that new package e48ea337ee3335c8bb3206a2501ce947ac1a7bdb1825cee8f28bad64f5a7bc4b (splice-wallet-payments v0.1.8) cannot be an upgrade of existing package 4e3e0d9cdadf80f4bf8f3cd3660d5287c084c9a29f23c901aabce597d72fd467 (splice-wallet-payments v0.1.7). I tried to search in the docs for a way to do so but don't find anything.

root.text: Question for Digital Asset people : do canton client (participant mostly I suppose) obey Proxy related ENV variables ? (to use an egress HTTP(s) proxy)

elements.text: Question for Digital Asset people : do canton client (participant mostly I suppose) obey Proxy related ENV variables ? (to use an egress HTTP(s) proxy)

text:
for anyone else having problems here, I’m setting up a antrea service in my k8s so I can have a single ip egress, even though my cluster might have multiple nodes each of them with their own public ip

Ref: <https://antrea.io/docs/main/docs/egress/>

elements.text:
for anyone else having problems here, I’m setting up a antrea service in my k8s so I can have a single ip egress, even though my cluster might have multiple nodes each of them with their own public ip

Ref:

text: no problem. sorry for all the trouble.

elements.text: no problem. sorry for all the trouble.

text: Yeah, could be a workaround for having 1 private cluster per instance per network

elements.text: Yeah, could be a workaround for having 1 private cluster per instance per network

text: Thanks for that <@U07A0QHGBS4>

elements.text: Thanks for that

text: <@U07A0QHGBS4> did you install Antrea as the main CNI plugin for your cluster

elements.text: did you install Antrea as the main CNI plugin for your cluster

text: <@U01TZB7MFFA> you can use node affinity or taints and tolerations to assign workloads to a specifics node inside your cluster. And your default CNI plugin should SNAT to the node IP on egress.

elements.text: you can use node affinity or taints and tolerations to assign workloads to a specifics node inside your cluster. And your default CNI plugin should SNAT to the node IP on egress.

text: the problem with this is when the node becomes unhealthy and needs to be deleted

elements.text: the problem with this is when the node becomes unhealthy and needs to be deleted

text: Indeed. We use <https://spidernet-io.github.io/egressgateway/|https://spidernet-io.github.io/egressgateway/> in our setup because it works with the most popular CNI plugins.

elements.text: Indeed. We use
https://spidernet-io.github.io/egressgateway/
in our setup because it works with the most popular CNI plugins.

text: We have setup a floating IP that can easily be moved to another node in the cluster in case the node where the workload is assigned to is unhealthy

elements.text: We have setup a floating IP that can easily be moved to another node in the cluster in case the node where the workload is assigned to is unhealthy

text: that’s quite similar, but looks more lightweight

elements.text: that’s quite similar, but looks more lightweight

text: Yes. Calico our CNI plugin has and egress gateway feature but only in the enterprise version. We didnt want to chance our CNI plugin so we using the spidernet controller instead

Hi team - attempting to validate our IP (54.66.181.181) on DevNet using the query in the docs, however I'm experiencing a unexpected error. Can please check if there's anything wrong in the query or setup wise for me to check? Expected at least to see the list and the results but nothing is outputting

```for url in $(curl -sSL <https://scan.sv-1.dev.global.canton.network.sync.global/api/scan/v0/scans> | jq -r '.scans | .[].scans | .[] | .publicUrl' ); do
  echo -n "$url: ";
  curl -sSL --connect-timeout 5 --fail-with-body $url/api/scan/version | jq -r '.version';
done```
>>>
`jq: parse error: Invalid numeric literal at EOF at line 1, column 9`

other details:

jq --version:
`jq-1.7`

`curl ifconfig.me: 54.66.181.181`
